_header: Look before thee how thy life wasteth
Note:
Cf. an inscription in St Paul’s Cathedral, pr. Camden (1633)
XCamden, William. Remains concerning Britain. London: J. Philipot, 1633, 1636; repr. London: J. R. Smith, 1870; Hildesheim, NY: G. Olms, 1970, 386; 1876, 413.
Subjects: inscriptions; advice, spiritual; death, approach of
Bibliographic Ghosts:
London, British Library Harley 1706: Not found in this MS, though listed for f. 204v by Horstmann (1895)
XHorstmann, Carl. Yorkshire Writers. 2 vols. London, Sonnenschein; New York: Macmillan, 1895-96 2:337, and for ff. 204-204v by Boffey and Edwards (2005)
XJulia Boffey, and A. S. G. Edwards. A New Index of Middle English Verse. London: The British Library, 2005 in NIMEV 1937.
_description: Respice ante te, retro te, etc. — five lines

CamMag13.First Lines:
Looke before the how thi lyfe wastythLooke behynde þe how thy
                    deth hastyth…
CamMag13.Last Lines:
…Looke man benethe þe þi payne withoute resteLooke
                    man aboue þe is yoye þat euer shall leste
CamMag13.Editions:
James,  Montague Rhodes. 
             A Descriptive Catalogue of the Manuscripts in the College Library of
                Magdalene College Cambridge.
         Cambridge: at the UP, 1909: 26.
